intro: Thyrsanthus pilosus, commonly known as the silky thyrsin, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, wiry stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are arranged in thyrses, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, often with a bluish-green hue. Thyrsanthus pilosus is typically found in coastal or rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
